cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: eye located over the Gulf of Gonave, about 35 mi NNE of Tiburon, Haiti and 90 mi S of the eastern tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north through Haiti and eastern Cuba today, turning NNW then NW toward the Bahamas Wednesday–Thursday and forecast to parallel the U.S. Southeast coast toward South Carolina and North Carolina late Friday through Saturday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina coast (around Charleston, SC)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Deerfield Beach FL to the Volusia/Brevard county line; Tropical-Storm Watch Seven Mile Bridge FL to south of Deerfield Beach FL including Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for Haiti, portions of Cuba, and the Southeastern-Central-Northwestern Bahamas; Tropical Storm Warning parts of the Dominican Republic and Turks and Caicos
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. Southeast coastline from Florida through the Carolinas, including Wilmington, NC area later in the period
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (potentially 40–60 mph sustained with higher gusts) possible late Friday night through Saturday as the core passes just offshore or inland.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels of 3–5 ft above ground possible on the lower Cape Fear coast if the center tracks close to shore.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could produce 4–8 inches with localized higher amounts, leading to flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and coastal erosion beginning late Friday.
